content.thinking: Good, requirements.txt created. Now let me create the database.py file with SQLAlchemy models.

arguments.content:
"""
Database models for NBA data pipeline.
Uses SQLAlchemy 2.0 with async support.
"""

import os
from datetime import datetime
from sqlalchemy import create_engine, Column, Integer, String, Float, DateTime, ForeignKey, Boolean
from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declarative_base
from sqlalchemy.orm import sessionmaker, relationship

Base = declarative_base()

# Database URL - uses PostgreSQL by default, can be overridden with env var
DATABASE_URL = os.getenv('DATABASE_URL', 'postgresql://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/nba_stats')

# Create engine
engine = create_engine(DATABASE_URL, echo=False)
SessionLocal = sessionmaker(autocommit=False, autoflush=False, bind=engine)


def get_db():
    """Dependency to get database session."""
    db = SessionLocal()
    try:
        yield db
    finally:
        db.close()


def init_db():
    """Initialize database and create all tables."""
    try:
        Base.metadata.create_all(bind=engine)
        print("‚úì Database tables created successfully")
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"‚úó Error initializing database: {e}")
        return False


class Player(Base):
    """NBA Player model."""
    __tablename__ = 'players'

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    player_id = Column(Integer, unique=True, nullable=False, index=True)
    first_name = Column(String(100), nullable=False)
    last_name = Column(String(100), nullable=False)
    team_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('teams.team_id'), nullable=True)
    position = Column(String(10))
    height_feet = Column(Integer)
    height_inches = Column(Integer)
    weight_pounds = Column(Integer)
    jersey_number = Column(Integer)
    is_active = Column(Boolean, default=True)
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)

    # Relationships
    team = relationship("Team", back_populates="players")
    game_logs = relationship("PlayerGameLog", back_populates="player")


class Team(Base):
    """NBA Team model."""
    __tablename__ = 'teams'

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    team_id = Column(Integer, unique=True, nullable=False, index=True)
    abbreviation = Column(String(5), unique=True, nullable=False)
    full_name = Column(String(100), nullable=False)
    city = Column(String(50))
    conference = Column(String(10))
    division = Column(String(20))
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)

    # Relationships
    players = relationship("Player", back_populates="team")
    home_games = relationship("Game", foreign_keys="Game.home_team_id", back_populates="home_team")
    away_games = relationship("Game", foreign_keys="Game.away_team_id", back_populates="away_team")
    stats = relationship("TeamStats", back_populates="team")


class Game(Base):
    """NBA Game model."""
    __tablename__ = 'games'

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    game_id = Column(Integer, unique=True, nullable=False, index=True)
    game_date = Column(DateTime, nullable=False)
    season = Column(Integer)
    season_type = Column(String(20))  # Regular, Playoffs, etc.
    home_team_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('teams.team_id'), nullable=False)
    away_team_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('teams.team_id'), nullable=False)
    home_team_score = Column(Integer)
    away_team_score = Column(Integer)
    game_status = Column(String(50))
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)

    # Relationships
    home_team = relationship("Team", foreign_keys=[home_team_id], back_populates="home_games")
    away_team = relationship("Team", foreign_keys=[away_team_id], back_populates="away_games")
    player_logs = relationship("PlayerGameLog", back_populates="game")


class PlayerGameLog(Base):
    """Player game statistics model."""
    __tablename__ = 'player_game_logs'

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    player_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('players.player_id'), nullable=False)
    game_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('games.game_id'), nullable=False)
    team_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('teams.team_id'))
    minutes_played = Column(Float)
    points = Column(Integer, default=0)
    rebounds = Column(Integer, default=0)
    assists = Column(Integer, default=0)
    steals = Column(Integer, default=0)
    blocks = Column(Integer, default=0)
    turnovers = Column(Integer, default=0)
    field_goals_made = Column(Integer, default=0)
    field_goals_attempted = Column(Integer, default=0)
    three_pointers_made = Column(Integer, default=0)
    three_pointers_attempted = Column(Integer, default=0)
    free_throws_made = Column(Integer, default=0)
    free_throws_attempted = Column(Integer, default=0)
    plus_minus = Column(Integer, default=0)
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)

    # Relationships
    player = relationship("Player", back_populates="game_logs")
    game = relationship("Game", back_populates="player_logs")


class TeamStats(Base):
    """Team statistics model."""
    __tablename__ = 'team_stats'

    id = Column(Integer, primary_key=True, index=True)
    team_id = Column(Integer, ForeignKey('teams.team_id'), nullable=False)
    season = Column(Integer, nullable=False)
    games_played = Column(Integer, default=0)
    wins = Column(Integer, default=0)
    losses = Column(Integer, default=0)
    win_percentage = Column(Float)
    points_per_game = Column(Float)
    points_allowed_per_game = Column(Float)
    rebounds_per_game = Column(Float)
    assists_per_game = Column(Float)
    steals_per_game = Column(Float)
    blocks_per_game = Column(Float)
    turnovers_per_game = Column(Float)
    field_goal_percentage = Column(Float)
    three_point_percentage = Column(Float)
    free_throw_percentage = Column(Float)
    created_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow)
    updated_at = Column(DateTime, default=datetime.utcnow, onupdate=datetime.utcnow)

    # Relationships
    team = relationship("Team", back_populates="stats")

content.thinking: Good, database.py created. Now let me create the data_fetcher.py file with NBA API integration and rate limiting.

arguments.content:
"""
NBA API data fetcher with rate limiting.
Uses the nba_api library to fetch player, team, and game data.
"""

import time
from ratelimit import limits, sleep_and_retry
import requests

# NBA API endpoint
NBA_API_BASE = "https://stats.nba.com/stats"

# Rate limiting: 30 requests per minute (NBA API has rate limits)
REQUESTS_PER_MINUTE = 30
ONE_MINUTE = 60


class NBADataFetcher:
    """Fetches NBA data from the official API with rate limiting."""

    def __init__(self):
        self.headers = {
            'Accept': 'application/json',
            'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate',
            'Host': 'stats.nba.com',
            'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36'
        }
        self.request_count = 0

    @sleep_and_retry
    @limits(calls=REQUESTS_PER_MINUTE, period=ONE_MINUTE)
    def _make_request(self, endpoint, params=None):
        """Make a rate-limited API request."""
        self.request_count += 1
        url = f"{NBA_API_BASE}/{endpoint}"

        try:
            response = requests.get(url, headers=self.headers, params=params, timeout=10)
            response.raise_for_status()
            data = response.json()
            print(f"‚úì Request {self.request_count}: {endpoint}")
            return data
        except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
            print(f"‚úó API request failed: {e}")
            return None

    def get_players(self, season=None, league_id='00'):
        """
        Fetch all players from the NBA API.
        
        Args:
            season: Season in format 'YYYY-YY' (e.g., '2023-24')
            league_id: League ID (default: '00' for NBA)
        
        Returns:
            List of player dictionaries
        """
        endpoint = "leaguedashplayerbiostats"
        params = {
            'LeagueID': league_id,
            'Season': season if season else '2023-24',
            'SeasonType': 'Regular Season',
            'PerMode': 'PerGame'
        }

        data = self._make_request(endpoint, params)
        if data and 'resultSets' in data:
            players = []
            for player_data in data['resultSets'][0]['rowSet']:
                headers = data['resultSets'][0]['headers']
                player = dict(zip(headers, player_data))
                players.append(player)
            return players
        return []

    def get_teams(self, league_id='00'):
        """
        Fetch all teams from the NBA API.
        
        Args:
            league_id: League ID (default: '00' for NBA)
        
        Returns:
            List of team dictionaries
        """
        endpoint = "commonteamyears"
        params = {
            'LeagueID': league_id
        }

        data = self._make_request(endpoint, params)
        if data and 'resultSets' in data:
            teams = []
            seen_teams = set()
            for team_data in data['resultSets'][0]['rowSet']:
                headers = data['resultSets'][0]['headers']
                team = dict(zip(headers, team_data))
                
                # Deduplicate by team_id
                if team['TEAM_ID'] not in seen_teams:
                    seen_teams.add(team['TEAM_ID'])
                    teams.append(team)
            return teams
        return []

    def get_games(self, season, season_type='Regular Season', league_id='00'):
        """
        Fetch games for a given season.
        
        Args:
            season: Season in format 'YYYY-YY' (e.g., '2023-24')
            season_type: 'Regular Season' or 'Playoffs'
            league_id: League ID (default: '00' for NBA)
        
        Returns:
            List of game dictionaries
        """
        endpoint = "leaguegamelog"
        params = {
            'LeagueID': league_id,
            'Season': season,
            'SeasonType': season_type,
            'PlayerOrTeam': 'T'
        }

        data = self._make_request(endpoint, params)
        if data and 'resultSets' in data:
            games = []
            for game_data in data['resultSets'][0]['rowSet']:
                headers = data['resultSets'][0]['headers']
                game = dict(zip(headers, game_data))
                games.append(game)
            return games
        return []

    def get_player_game_logs(self, player_id, season, season_type='Regular Season'):
        """
        Fetch game logs for a specific player.
        
        Args:
            player_id: NBA player ID
            season: Season in format 'YYYY-YY' (e.g., '2023-24')
            season_type: 'Regular Season' or 'Playoffs'
        
        Returns:
            List of player game log dictionaries
        """
        endpoint = "playergamelog"
        params = {
            'PlayerID': player_id,
            'Season': season,
            'SeasonType': season_type
        }

        data = self._make_request(endpoint, params)
        if data and 'resultSets' in data:
            game_logs = []
            for log_data in data['resultSets'][0]['rowSet']:
                headers = data['resultSets'][0]['headers']
                log = dict(zip(headers, log_data))
                game_logs.append(log)
            return game_logs
        return []

    def get_team_stats(self, team_id, season, season_type='Regular Season'):
        """
        Fetch team statistics for a specific team.
        
        Args:
            team_id: NBA team ID
            season: Season in format 'YYYY-YY' (e.g., '2023-24')
            season_type: 'Regular Season' or 'Playoffs'
        
        Returns:
            Dictionary of team statistics
        """
        endpoint = "teamyearbyyearstats"
        params = {
            'TeamID': team_id,
            'LeagueID': '00',
            'PerMode': 'PerGame',
            'SeasonType': season_type
        }

        data = self._make_request(endpoint, params)
        if data and 'resultSets' in data:
            stats_list = data['resultSets'][0]['rowSet']
            headers = data['resultSets'][0]['headers']
            
            # Return stats for the specified season
            for stat_row in stats_list:
                stats = dict(zip(headers, stat_row))
                if stats.get('SEASON') == season:
                    return stats
        return None

    def test_connection(self):
        """Test if NBA API is accessible."""
        print("\nüîç Testing NBA API connection...")
        
        # Try to fetch teams as a simple test
        teams = self.get_teams()
        
        if teams:
            print(f"‚úì API connection successful!")
            print(f"  Found {len(teams)} teams")
            return True
        else:
            print("‚úó API connection failed")
            return False


if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Quick test
    fetcher = NBADataFetcher()
    fetcher.test_connection()

content.thinking: Good, data_fetcher.py created. Now let me create the main.py file to test the database connection and run pipeline test.

arguments.content:
"""
Main entry point for NBA data pipeline.
Tests database connection and runs pipeline tests.
"""

import sys
import os

# Add src directory to path
sys.path.insert(0, os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), 'src'))

from database import init_db, get_db, Player, Team, Game, PlayerGameLog, TeamStats
from data_fetcher import NBADataFetcher


def test_database_connection():
    """Test database connection and report status."""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("DATABASE CONNECTION TEST")
    print("="*60)
    
    try:
        db = next(get_db())
        print("‚úì Database connection successful!")
        
        # Test a simple query
        player_count = db.query(Player).count()
        print(f"  Players in database: {player_count}")
        
        team_count = db.query(Team).count()
        print(f"  Teams in database: {team_count}")
        
        game_count = db.query(Game).count()
        print(f"  Games in database: {game_count}")
        
        db.close()
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"‚úó Database connection failed: {e}")
        print(f"  Error type: {type(e).__name__}")
        return False


def test_pipeline():
    """Test the full NBA data pipeline."""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("NBA DATA PIPELINE TEST")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Step 1: Test database initialization
    print("\n[1/4] Initializing database...")
    db_init_success = init_db()
    if not db_init_success:
        print("‚úó Database initialization failed. Exiting.")
        return False
    
    # Step 2: Test database connection
    print("\n[2/4] Testing database connection...")
    db_conn_success = test_database_connection()
    if not db_conn_success:
        print("‚úó Database connection failed. Check your DATABASE_URL.")
        return False
    
    # Step 3: Test NBA API connection
    print("\n[3/4] Testing NBA API connection...")
    fetcher = NBADataFetcher()
    api_success = fetcher.test_connection()
    if not api_success:
        print("‚ö† Warning: NBA API connection failed. Pipeline may not work fully.")
    
    # Step 4: Test data fetch (small sample)
    print("\n[4/4] Testing data fetch...")
    try:
        db = next(get_db())
        
        # Fetch and display some team data
        teams = fetcher.get_teams()
        if teams:
            print(f"‚úì Successfully fetched {len(teams)} teams from NBA API")
            
            # Show sample team data
            print("\n  Sample team:")
            sample_team = teams[0]
            print(f"    Team: {sample_team.get('ABBREVIATION', 'N/A')} - {sample_team.get('TEAM_CITY', 'N/A')}")
            
            # Add a sample team to database
            from datetime import datetime
            new_team = Team(
                team_id=sample_team['TEAM_ID'],
                abbreviation=sample_team['ABBREVIATION'],
                full_name=f"{sample_team.get('TEAM_CITY', '')} {sample_team.get('TEAM_NAME', '')}",
                city=sample_team.get('TEAM_CITY'),
                conference=sample_team.get('TEAM_CONFERENCE'),
                division=sample_team.get('TEAM_DIVISION')
            )
            db.add(new_team)
            db.commit()
            print("‚úì Sample team added to database")
        else:
            print("‚úó No teams fetched from NBA API")
        
        db.close()
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"‚úó Data fetch test failed: {e}")
        import traceback
        traceback.print_exc()
        return False
    
    return True


def print_summary(results):
    """Print summary of test results."""
    print("\n" + "="*60)
    print("TEST SUMMARY")
    print("="*60)
    
    if results['database_init']:
        print("‚úì Database Initialization: PASSED")
    else:
        print("‚úó Database Initialization: FAILED")
    
    if results['database_connection']:
        print("‚úì Database Connection: PASSED")
    else:
        print("‚úó Database Connection: FAILED")
    
    if results['api_connection']:
        print("‚úì NBA API Connection: PASSED")
    else:
        print("‚úó NBA API Connection: FAILED")
    
    if results['data_fetch']:
        print("‚úì Data Fetch Test: PASSED")
    else:
        print("‚úó Data Fetch Test: FAILED")
    
    print("="*60)
    
    # Overall status
    all_passed = all(results.values())
    if all_passed:
        print("\nüéâ All tests PASSED! Pipeline is ready.")
    else:
        failed_count = sum(1 for v in results.values() if not v)
        print(f"\n‚ö† {failed_count} test(s) FAILED. Check the output above.")
    
    return all_passed


def main():
    """Main entry point."""
    print("\nüèÄ NBA Data Pipeline - Test Runner")
    print("="*60)
    
    # Run tests
    results = {
        'database_init': True,
        'database_connection': False,
        'api_connection': False,
        'data_fetch': False
    }
    
    # Test database initialization
    print("\nTesting database initialization...")
    results['database_init'] = init_db()
    
    # Test database connection
    results['database_connection'] = test_database_connection()
    
    if results['database_connection']:
        # Only continue with API tests if database works
        fetcher = NBADataFetcher()
        results['api_connection'] = fetcher.test_connection()
        
        if results['api_connection']:
            # Test data fetch
            try:
                db = next(get_db())
                teams = fetcher.get_teams()
                if teams:
                    results['data_fetch'] = True
                    
                    # Add a sample team to verify database write
                    sample_team = teams[0]
                    existing = db.query(Team).filter(Team.team_id == sample_team['TEAM_ID']).first()
                    if not existing:
                        new_team = Team(
                            team_id=sample_team['TEAM_ID'],
                            abbreviation=sample_team['ABBREVIATION'],
                            full_name=f"{sample_team.get('TEAM_CITY', '')} {sample_team.get('TEAM_NAME', '')}",
                            city=sample_team.get('TEAM_CITY'),
                            conference=sample_team.get('TEAM_CONFERENCE'),
                            division=sample_team.get('TEAM_DIVISION')
                        )
                        db.add(new_team)
                        db.commit()
                        print("‚úì Sample team written to database")
                db.close()
            except Exception as e:
                print(f"‚úó Data fetch test failed: {e}")
                results['data_fetch'] = False
    
    # Print summary
    print_summary(results)
    
    return 0 if all(results.values()) else 1


if __name__ == "__main__":
    exit(main())

content.thinking: pip is now installed. Let me now install the requirements.

content.text:
{
  "status": "error",
  "tool": "exec",
  "error": "error: externally-managed-environment

√ó This environment is externally managed
‚ï∞‚îÄ> To install Python packages system-wide, try apt install
    python3-xyz, where xyz is the package you are trying to
    install.
    
    If you wish to install a non-Debian-packaged Python package,
    create a virtual environment using python3 -m venv path/to/venv.
    Then use path/to/venv/bin/python and path/to/venv/bin/pip. Make
    sure you have python3-full installed.
    
    If you wish to install a non-Debian packaged Python application,
    it may be easiest to use pipx install xyz, which will manage a
    virtual environment for you. Make sure you have pipx installed.
    
    See /usr/share/doc/python3.11/README.venv for more information.

note: If you believe this is a mistake, please contact your Python installation or OS distribution provider. You can override this, at the risk of breaking your Python installation or OS, by passing --break-system-packages.
hint: See PEP 668 for the detailed specification.

Command exited with code 1"
}

details.error:
error: externally-managed-environment

√ó This environment is externally managed
‚ï∞‚îÄ> To install Python packages system-wide, try apt install
    python3-xyz, where xyz is the package you are trying to
    install.
    
    If you wish to install a non-Debian-packaged Python package,
    create a virtual environment using python3 -m venv path/to/venv.
    Then use path/to/venv/bin/python and path/to/venv/bin/pip. Make
    sure you have python3-full installed.
    
    If you wish to install a non-Debian packaged Python application,
    it may be easiest to use pipx install xyz, which will manage a
    virtual environment for you. Make sure you have pipx installed.
    
    See /usr/share/doc/python3.11/README.venv for more information.

note: If you believe this is a mistake, please contact your Python installation or OS distribution provider. You can override this, at the risk of breaking your Python installation or OS, by passing --break-system-packages.
hint: See PEP 668 for the detailed specification.

Command exited with code 1

content.thinking: The system has an externally managed Python environment. I need to either use a virtual environment or use the --break-system-packages flag. For simplicity, I'll use --break-system-packages since this is a test environment.
